III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iii)Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff and youth got into an argument in which another staff person
had to break it up and youth felt staff's hand on her cheek.
Investigation I reviewed intake dated 04/07/2023. It states last night Youth A
threw water on Staff Person 1 and as a result Staff Person 1 was
mad at Youth A. The two got into an argument which another staff
person had to break it up. At one point Youth A reports feeling
Staff Person 1’s hand on her cheek. Youth A has no marks or
bruises from the altercation. Complainant and Director has no
additions allegations.
Incident reports from Staff Person 1, 2, 3, and Director dated
04/06/2023 between the 06:00pm and 09:54pm were reviewed.
They are consistent in reporting that Youth A was outside, not
completing chores, and then entered the unit and began arguing
with staff about her chores. Youth A left the unit again and
sometime later came back on the unit. Youth A went to her
bedroom and asked where her belongings were and began
arguing and threatening to pour water and soap on all staff. Staff
Person 1 began to attempt to verbally deescalate Youth A. Youth
A became increasing agitated and approached Staff Person 1.
Staff Person 2 and 3 intervened as Youth A threw water at Staff
Person 1. Staff Person 1 was directed to exit the area as she was
Youth A’s target. Youth A continued to be escalated and began
throwing items out of the refrigerator. Director began intervening
at which point Youth A proceeded to exit the facility with staff
shadowing her.
I attempted to interview Youth A onsite on 04/11/2023. She
reports being placed at the facility sometime after Christmas from
a foster home placement. She reports that she does not like her
current placement and wants to move back to Detroit. Youth A
states she does not want to discuss what transpired when she
poured water on staff.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 onsite on 04/11/2023. She reports
being employed as a youth care worker by the facility for four
months and is up to date with her training requirements. She
reports having a good rapport with Youth A and states she came
outside to discuss her chore completion with Staff Person 2 and 4.
She reports Youth A was upset about everything when she
returned inside the unit and began asking aggressively about the
whereabouts of her DVD player and threatening to throw water on
staff. She states Staff Persons 2, 3, and 4 were present and
2

attempted to verbally intervene prior to Youth A throwing water at
her. Staff Person 1 reports Youth A then threw water at her and
that Staff Person 2 stepped in between the two after it occurred
and directed Staff Person 1 to step away as she was the target of
Youth A’s anger. Staff Person 1 states she attempted to secure
the water bottle from Youth A but was not able to do so. She also
denies placing her hand on Youth A’s check as she alleges. Staff
Person 1 reports she left the unit for a couple minutes and upon
return to retrieve some of her belongings noticed Youth A messing
with the refrigerator and that she again left the unit.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 onsite on 04/11/2023. She states
Staff Person 1 was attempting to verbally deescalate Youth A
noting that Staff Person 1 is usually good with Youth A and that
Youth A responds well to Staff Person 1. Staff Person 2 states
Youth A was becoming even more escalated and decided to
switch positions with Staff Person 1 at which point Youth A threw
water on the two of them. She states she did not observe were
anyone’s hands were placed as both she and Staff Person 1 were
wiping water away. Staff Person 2 states directing Staff Person 1
out of the area as Staff Person 1 appeared to be Youth A’s target.
Staff Person 2 states Staff Person 1 was repeatedly attempting to
verbally deescalate Youth A and did not observe any antagonizing
of her.
I interviewed Staff Person 3 via telephone on 04/11/2023. She
reports being employed as a youth care worker by the facility for
six months and is up to date with her training requirements. She
reports Youth A was escalated and that Staff Person 1 was
attempting to verbally deescalate her without antagonizing her.
She reports Youth A threw water at Staff Person 1 and was trying
to further charge toward her. She reports her and Staff Person 2
attempted to direct Youth A away from Staff Person 1 for Staff
Person 1 to exit the area as she was the identified target of Youth
A’s aggression. She states staff attempted to grab the water
bottle just as Youth A threw the water and does not recall
observing anyone’s hand come close to Youth A’s face.
I interviewed Staff Person 4 onsite on 04/11/2023. She reports
being employed as a youth care worker by the facility since
12/2022 and is up to date with her training requirements. She
states Youth A usually has a good relationship with Staff Person 1
and that Youth A can to talk with Staff Person 1 with relative ease.
She reports Youth A was escalated and that Staff Person 3 was
walking with her as Staff Person 1 was attempting to verbally
deescalate her. Staff Person 4 states she was in the process of
3

escorting the other residents down the hallway and turned to see
Staff Person 2 and 3 step in between Youth A and Staff Person 1
and Youth A threw the water.
I interviewed Director 1 onsite on 04/11/2023. She states she did
not observe the incident in which water was thrown. She reports
observing Youth A throwing items and pushing staff. Staff were
able to calm her down slightly at which point Youth A exited the
unit. After Youth A returning to the unit, she explained to Director
what had occurred with the water. She notes Youth A appeared
to be in a power struggle when she mentioned a hand on her
check during the incident and that Youth A would not further
elaborate on the details.
Analysis There is no conclusive evidence to indicate that Youth A and Staff
Person 1 were arguing to the point that another staff person had
to break it up. Staff present all report Youth A being angry,
argumentative, and threatening upon entering the unit. All staff
report Staff Person 1 has good rapport with Youth A and was
attempting to verbally deescalate her and that Youth A targeted
her anger toward Staff Person 1. Staff Persons 2 and 3 were
aware of Youth A’s potential explosiveness and positioned
themselves accordingly and intervened as Youth A threw water at
Staff Person 1 and 2. Staff Person 1 removed herself from the
scene as she was Youth A’s identified target and continued to be
escalated once she left the unit. There is also no conclusive
evidence to indicate staff’s hand was on Youth A’s cheek. Youth
A refused to be interviewed regarding the incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

No change to the current license is recommended.
